required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nexavar Post-marketing Surveillance for Renal Cell Carcinoma in Japan
clinical_study.official_title: Special Drug Use Investigation of Nexavar (Unresectable or Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a regulatory post-marketing surveillance in Japan, and it is a local prospective and observational study of patients who have been administered with Nexavar for unresectable or advanced renal cell carcinoma (RCC). The objective of this study is to assess safety and effectiveness of Nexavar under real-life practice conditions. This study is an all case investigation of which the enrollment period is 15 months, and all patients who received Nexavar will be recruited and followed one year since starting Nexavar administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions and serious adverse events in subjects who received Nexavar
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Nexavar administration, up to 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions in subpopulation in a variety of baseline data [such as demographic data, concomitant disease, medical history data, clinical staging, etiology of HCC, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group-Performance Status (ECOG-PS)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Nexavar administration, up to 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness evaluation assessment [overall survival, response rate, stable disease rate, progression disease rate] by investigator-determined overall best response [according to the General rule for clinical and pathological studies on RCC]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Nexavar administration, up to 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: The status of therapy with Nexavar [duration of treatment, daily dose]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Nexavar administration, up to 1 year

intervention.description: Patients who have received Nexavar for unresectable or advanced RCC.

study_pop.textblock: This study is all cases investigation of which the enrollment period is 15 months, and all patients who received Nexavar for unresectable or advanced RCC will be recruited.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received Nexavar for unresectable or advanced renal cell carcinoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are contraindicated based on the product label

link.description: Click here to find results for studies related to Bayer products.

clinical_study.keyword: Unresectable or advanced renal cell carcinoma
